intro: Calycomelia caroliniana, commonly known as the Carolina calycornis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in the summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Calycomelia caroliniana is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
